pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:0.5: 24. The training rule on rainy-season robes
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.2: At that time the Buddha had allowed the rainy-season robe for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.3: Knowing that this was the case, the monks from the group of six
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.4: went looking for cloth for their rainy-season robes early.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.5: And after sewing them early, they wore them.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.6: Then, because their rainy-season robes were worn, they bathed naked in the rain.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.7: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.8: “How can the monks from the group of six go looking for cloth for their rainy-season robes early, sew them early, and then wear them, and then, because their rainy-season robes are worn, bathe naked in the rain?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.9: After rebuking the monks from the group of six in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.10: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.15: “… Foolish men, how can you go looking for cloth for your rainy-season robes early, sew them early, and then wear them, and then, because your rainy-season robes are worn, bathe naked in the rain?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.16: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.17: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.18.1: ‘When there is a month left of the hot season, a monk may go looking for cloth for his rainy-season robe. When there is a half-month left, he may sew it and then wear it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:1.19: If he goes looking for cloth for his rainy-season robe when there is more than a month left of the hot season, or if he sews it and then wears it when there is more than a half-month left, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.1: When there is a month left of the hot season, a monk may go looking for cloth for his rainy-season robe:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.2: after approaching those people who previously, too, have given cloth for the rainy-season robes, he should say, “It’s time for the rainy-season robe,” “It’s the occasion for the rainy-season robe,” “Other people, too, are giving cloth for the rainy-season robe.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.3: He should not say, “Give me cloth for the rainy-season robe,” “Bring me cloth for the rainy-season robe,” “Swap me cloth for the rainy-season robe,” “Buy me cloth for the rainy-season robe.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.4: When there is a half-month left, he may sew it and then wear it:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.5: after sewing it during the last half-month of the hot season, he may wear it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.6: When there is more than a month left of the hot season:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.7: if he goes looking for cloth for the rainy-season robe when there is more than a month left of the hot season, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.8: When there is more than a half-month left:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.9: if he wears it after sewing it when there is more than a half-month left of the hot season, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.10: The rainy-season robe should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.11: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.12: (To be expanded as in [Relinquishment 1](pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.5--3.2.29), with appropriate substitutions.)
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.13: ‘Venerables, this cloth for the rainy-season robe which I went looking for when there was more than a month left of the hot season or which I wore after sewing it when there was more than a half-month left of the hot season is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.14: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.17: ‘I give this cloth for the rainy-season robe back to you.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.18.1: If there is more than a month left of the hot season, and he perceives it as more, and he goes looking for cloth for a rainy-season robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.19: If there is more than a month left of the hot season, but he is unsure of it, and he goes looking for cloth for a rainy-season robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.20: If there is more than a month left of the hot season, but he perceives it as less, and he goes looking for cloth for a rainy-season robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.21: If there is more than a half-month left of the hot season, and he perceives it as more, and he wears the rainy-season robe after sewing it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.22: If there is more than a half-month left of the hot season, but he is unsure of it, and he wears the rainy-season robe after sewing it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.23: If there is more than a half-month left of the hot season, but he perceives it as less, and he wears the rainy-season robe after sewing it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.24: If he has a rainy-season robe, but he bathes naked in the rain, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.25: If there is less than a month left of the hot season, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.26: If there is less than a month left of the hot season, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.27: If there is less than a month left of the hot season, and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.28: If there is less than a half-month left of the hot season, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.29: If there is less than a half-month left of the hot season, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.30: If there is less than a half-month left of the hot season, and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.32: if he goes looking for cloth for the rainy-season robe when there is a month left of the hot season;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.33: if he wears the rainy-season robe after sewing it when there is a half-month left of the hot season;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.34: if he goes looking for cloth for the rainy-season robe when there is less than a month left of the hot season;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.35: if he wears the rainy-season robe after sewing it when there is less than a half-month left of the hot season;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.36: if, after looking for a rainy-season robe, he postpones the rainy-season residence;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.37: if, after wearing a rainy-season robe, he postpones the rainy-season residence (in which case he should wash it and store it and then use it at the right time);
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.38: if his robe has been stolen;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.39: if his robe has been lost;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.42: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np24:2.43: The fourth rule, the training rule on rainy-season robes, is finished.
